question.title: Maximum Ascending Subarray Sum
question.content:
Given an array of positive integers nums, return the maximum possible sum of an ascending subarray in nums.

A subarray is defined as a contiguous sequence of numbers in an array.

A subarray [numsl, numsl+1, ..., numsr-1, numsr] is ascending if for all i where l <= i < r, numsi < numsi+1. Note that a subarray of size 1 is ascending.

 

Example 1:

Input: nums = [10,20,30,5,10,50]
Output: 65
Explanation: [5,10,50] is the ascending subarray with the maximum sum of 65.

Example 2:

Input: nums = [10,20,30,40,50]
Output: 150
Explanation: [10,20,30,40,50] is the ascending subarray with the maximum sum of 150.

Example 3:

Input: nums = [12,17,15,13,10,11,12]
Output: 33
Explanation: [10,11,12] is the ascending subarray with the maximum sum of 33.

 

Constraints:

  • 1 <= nums.length <= 100
  • 1 <= nums[i] <= 100

hints: It is fast enough to check all possible subarrays
The end of each ascending subarray will be the start of the next

rephrased.body: Given an array of positive integers `nums`, find the maximum possible sum of an ascending subarray within `nums`. An ascending subarray is defined as a contiguous sequence of numbers where each element is strictly greater than the previous one. A single element is also considered an ascending subarray.

testcases.explanation: The ascending subarray with the maximum sum is [5,10,50], which sums to 65.
The entire array [10,20,30,40,50] is an ascending subarray, and its sum is 150.
The ascending subarray with the maximum sum is [10,11,12], resulting in a sum of 33.
